intro: Calycogonium heterotrichum, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's structure and growth habits reflect adaptations to its arid and semi-arid habitats.
